column4: is it a ppa you have the trouble with, if so you can remove it at, gksudo nautlius /etc/apt/sources.list.d
, read my post above ...maybe you missed it.
I missed it indeed. So I deleted all the files from that dir, there were to for a freenx repo. The error after apt-get update is still there though.
I didn't mean for you to delete all the files from sources.list.d , just the ppas that were giving the gpg key errors
